page.title: 17FIELD SPORTS IN WARDOUR
page.content: {Hunting. Mr Arundell}told us about {hunting.}They hunt in the{Abbey woods for{Foxes and Mink.}The{hounds}eat the Foxes when they catch them. They hunt Foxes on horses and Mink on foot. Lots of the animals get away from them. The {hunt}meets about 20 times a year. {Shooting }Mr Arundell's favourite sport is shooting. He shoots{woodcock, {snipe, duck, teal}and{partridges}but mainly{pheasants.}You shoot snipe about Christmas time. {Fishing.}Mr Arundell fishes in{Wardour {lakes.}He normally catches{Carp}and {Trout.}Mr Arundell eats the trout. the {Tisbury Angling club}fish in the {Nadder}and the{Ark pond.}The fishing season is six months long. Mr Arundell loves fishing. About a{100 people}take part in field sports in this area. {Charlotte and Christabel.
